Am 22.06.2007 um 11:18 schrieb Julian Reschke:
> Julian Reschke wrote:
> >
> >
> > Marc de Graauw wrote:
> > > ...
> > > And one issue is still open: if I have some logic where I want the
> > server to
> > > create the URI but the logic is idempotent, what do I do?
> > > ...
> >
> > I've been proposing ADDMEMBER
> > (<http://greenbytes. de/tech/webdav/ draft-reschke- http-addmember-
> > 00.html
> > <http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/draft-reschke-http- 
> addmember-00.html>>),
> > but was told it doesn't add anything to POST. I disagree with  
> that (and
> > so do others), but hadn't the energy to follow up on this one.
>
> Hm, I have to take that back. ADDMEMBER of course is not itempotent,
> because repeating a request will lead to another resource being  
> created.
>
> So you'll need something in the message that allows a server to  
> detect a
> duplicate of a request.

There is the POE proposal by Mark Nottingham:

http://www.mnot.net/drafts/draft-nottingham-http-poe-00.txt
